title: Peter Beardsley's International Football
text:
Peter Beardsley's International Football is a <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="video%20game">video game</a> developed in 1988 by <a href="Grandslam%20Entertainment">Grandslam</a> and endorsed by <a href="Peter%20Beardsley">Peter Beardsley</a>.
Gameplay.
Players select an international team to play as, and can choose to play against the computer in a one player league format, or two players in a two player league format. They can then select the other teams in each group. 
Reception.
The <a href="Commodore%2064">Commodore 64</a> version was reviewed poorly by "<a href="Zzap%2164">Zzap!64</a>", which gave it a score of 23%, stating that it is "one of the worst football games around at the moment".
